nfc-emulate-uid.c

00047 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00048 #  include "config.h"
00049 #endif // HAVE_CONFIG_H
00050 
00051 #include <stdio.h>
00052 #include <stdlib.h>
00053 #include <stddef.h>
00054 #include <stdint.h>
00055 #include <string.h>
00056 #include <signal.h>
00057 
00058 #include <nfc/nfc.h>
00059 
00060 #include "utils/nfc-utils.h"
00061 
00062 #define MAX_FRAME_LEN 264
00063 
00064 static uint8_t abtRecv[MAX_FRAME_LEN];
00065 static int szRecvBits;
00066 static nfc_device *pnd;
00067 static nfc_context *context;
00068 
00069 // ISO14443A Anti-Collision response
00070 uint8_t  abtAtqa[2] = { 0x04, 0x00 };
00071 uint8_t  abtUidBcc[5] = { 0xDE, 0xAD, 0xBE, 0xEF, 0x22 };
00072 uint8_t  abtSak[9] = { 0x08, 0xb6, 0xdd };
00073 
00074 static void
00075 intr_hdlr(int sig)
00076 {
00077   (void) sig;
00078   if (pnd != NULL) {
00079     printf("\nAborting current command...\n");
00080     nfc_abort_command(pnd);
00081   }
00082 }
00083 
00084 static void
00085 print_usage(char *argv[])
00086 {
00087   printf("Usage: %s [OPTIONS] [UID]\n", argv[0]);
00088   printf("Options:\n");
00089   printf("\t-h\tHelp. Print this message.\n");
00090   printf("\t-q\tQuiet mode. Silent output: received and sent frames will not be shown (improves timing).\n");
00091   printf("\n");
00092   printf("\t[UID]\tUID to emulate, specified as 8 HEX digits (default is DEADBEEF).\n");
00093 }
00094 
00095 int
00096 main(int argc, char *argv[])
00097 {
00098   uint8_t *pbtTx = NULL;
00099   size_t  szTxBits;
00100   bool    quiet_output = false;
00101 
00102   int     arg,
00103           i;
00104 
00105   // Get commandline options
00106   for (arg = 1; arg < argc; arg++) {
00107     if (0 == strcmp(argv[arg], "-h")) {
00108       print_usage(argv);
00109       exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00110     } else if (0 == strcmp(argv[arg], "-q")) {
00111       printf("Quiet mode.\n");
00112       quiet_output = true;
00113     } else if ((arg == argc - 1) && (strlen(argv[arg]) == 8)) {         // See if UID was specified as HEX string
00114       uint8_t  abtTmp[3] = { 0x00, 0x00, 0x00 };
00115       printf("[+] Using UID: %s\n", argv[arg]);
00116       abtUidBcc[4] = 0x00;
00117       for (i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
00118         memcpy(abtTmp, argv[arg] + i * 2, 2);
00119         abtUidBcc[i] = (uint8_t) strtol((char *) abtTmp, NULL, 16);
00120         abtUidBcc[4] ^= abtUidBcc[i];
00121       }
00122     } else {
00123       ERR("%s is not supported option.", argv[arg]);
00124       print_usage(argv);
00125       exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00126     }
00127   }
00128 
00129 #ifdef WIN32
00130   signal(SIGINT, (void (__cdecl *)(int)) intr_hdlr);
00131 #else
00132   signal(SIGINT, intr_hdlr);
00133 #endif
00134 
00135   nfc_init(&context);
00136   if (context == NULL) {
00137     ERR("Unable to init libnfc (malloc)");
00138     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00139   }
00140 
00141   // Try to open the NFC device
00142   pnd = nfc_open(context, NULL);
00143 
00144   if (pnd == NULL) {
00145     ERR("Unable to open NFC device");
00146     nfc_exit(context);
00147     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00148   }
00149 
00150   printf("\n");
00151   printf("NFC device: %s opened\n", nfc_device_get_name(pnd));
00152   printf("[+] Try to break out the auto-emulation, this requires a second NFC device!\n");
00153   printf("[+] To do this, please send any command after the anti-collision\n");
00154   printf("[+] For example, send a RATS command or use the \"nfc-anticol\" or \"nfc-list\" tool.\n");
00155 
00156   // Note: We have to build a "fake" nfc_target in order to do exactly the same that was done before the new nfc_target_init() was introduced.
00157   nfc_target nt = {
00158     .nm = {
00159       .nmt = NMT_ISO14443A,
00160       .nbr = NBR_UNDEFINED,
00161     },
00162     .nti = {
00163       .nai = {
00164         .abtAtqa = { 0x04, 0x00 },
00165         .abtUid = { 0x08, 0xad, 0xbe, 0xef },
00166         .btSak = 0x20,
00167         .szUidLen = 4,
00168         .szAtsLen = 0,
00169       },
00170     },
00171   };
00172   if ((szRecvBits = nfc_target_init(pnd, &nt, abtRecv, sizeof(abtRecv), 0)) < 0) {
00173     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_target_init");
00174     ERR("Could not come out of auto-emulation, no command was received");
00175     nfc_close(pnd);
00176     nfc_exit(context);
00177     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00178   }
00179   printf("[+] Received initiator command: ");
00180   print_hex_bits(abtRecv, (size_t) szRecvBits);
00181   printf("[+] Configuring communication\n");
00182   if ((nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_HANDLE_CRC, false) < 0) || (nfc_device_set_property_bool(pnd, NP_HANDLE_PARITY, true) < 0)) {
00183     nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_device_set_property_bool");
00184     nfc_close(pnd);
00185     nfc_exit(context);
00186     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00187   }
00188   printf("[+] Done, the emulated tag is initialized with UID: %02X%02X%02X%02X\n\n", abtUidBcc[0], abtUidBcc[1],
00189          abtUidBcc[2], abtUidBcc[3]);
00190 
00191   while (true) {
00192     // Test if we received a frame
00193     if ((szRecvBits = nfc_target_receive_bits(pnd, abtRecv, sizeof(abtRecv), 0)) > 0) {
00194       // Prepare the command to send back for the anti-collision request
00195       switch (szRecvBits) {
00196         case 7:                  // Request or Wakeup
00197           pbtTx = abtAtqa;
00198           szTxBits = 16;
00199           // New anti-collsion session started
00200           if (!quiet_output)
00201             printf("\n");
00202           break;
00203 
00204         case 16:                 // Select All
00205           pbtTx = abtUidBcc;
00206           szTxBits = 40;
00207           break;
00208 
00209         case 72:                 // Select Tag
00210           pbtTx = abtSak;
00211           szTxBits = 24;
00212           break;
00213 
00214         default:                 // unknown length?
00215           szTxBits = 0;
00216           break;
00217       }
00218 
00219       if (!quiet_output) {
00220         printf("R: ");
00221         print_hex_bits(abtRecv, (size_t) szRecvBits);
00222       }
00223       // Test if we know how to respond
00224       if (szTxBits) {
00225         // Send and print the command to the screen
00226         if (nfc_target_send_bits(pnd, pbtTx, szTxBits, NULL) < 0) {
00227           nfc_perror(pnd, "nfc_target_send_bits");
00228           nfc_close(pnd);
00229           nfc_exit(context);
00230           exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00231         }
00232         if (!quiet_output) {
00233           printf("T: ");
00234           print_hex_bits(pbtTx, szTxBits);
00235         }
00236       }
00237     }
00238   }
00239   nfc_close(pnd);
00240   nfc_exit(context);
00241   exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00242 }
Generated on Fri Apr 5 2013 16:09:19 for libnfc by   1.7.6.1
